verbose_text: Under ischemic conditions, the release of excess EAAs contributes to the overactivation of ionotropic NMDA receptors and alpha-amino-3-hydroxy-5-methyl-4-isoxazolepropionic acid (AMPA) receptors, which mediate the excessive entry of Ca 2+, initiating glutamate induced excitotoxicity, and finally, these excitotoxic processes eventually lead to neuronal death in the hippocampal CA1 region.
evidence: AMPA) receptors, which mediate the excessive entry of Ca
